climbs.name: Spaced Out
climbs.fa: GU Kevander Fox, Dylan Welcome, summer 2017

content.description: Originally done ground up on gear, 5 bolts added due to some discerning rock quality issues, bring a single rack up to 4" if you're not a confident 5.9 leader and you'll be happy.
content.protection: 5 bolts, opt. gear to 4", bolted anchors

content.description: .5 and #1 to protect the initial moves up to the first bolt.  Series of compression and hand-jams in flaring cracks as well as some small desperate crimps get you up through the first 4 bolts.  A good ledge provides rest before the headwall, 2 bolts and good face holds finish to a 3 bolt anchor.
content.protection: 6 bolts + .5 and #1 to protect up to the first bolt.  All bolts are 3/8" stainless.

content.description: Start right of the main crack traversing left past 3 bolts into some jumbled flakes and up to an easy crack with finicky but solid natural gear. Clip one more bolt for good measure before getting to the anchors. Crux is at the second bolt and is not as easy if your short/ have a small reach, hence the plus rating.
Fun sustained corner crack climbing leads to face
content.protection: offset nuts, micro gear to 3", bolted mussy anchor
content.location:
far right side of Starr Wall, small dihedral with black streak on green face left of corner.

Shares anchors with Deadpool, and Dwarf Starr

content.description: Very fun, well bolted sport climb. Climb gingerly on the questionable blocks at the second bolt.
content.location: Just right of Guano hold your hand.

content.description: From the ground: Crank a boulder problem on shallow pockets then climb the super flared crack with insecure jams. A succinct boulder problem on two-finger pockets connects the discontinuous cracks. Lower off.
content.protection:
First bolt may be hard to clip, consider stick-clipping (crux is right off the ground).

Tape, cams from fingers-wide hands, 3 protection bolts, 2-bolt anchor with lower-offs.
content.location: Next route right of Left Handed Drummer.

content.description: Climb the broken featured crack line between ‘Soulstice’ and ‘Left handed drummer.’ A bit runout to the first bolt and a bit spaced out between 2 & 3 but not bad. Cruxes are well protected. Supplement with natural pro or just clip the bolts for a fun sport lead. Much less intimidating if the draws are already hung, so make sure you get first go! Don’t pull too hard on the detached looking block about 8’ off the ground. Mind the guano.

Follow cracks onto a ledge and climb the crack in the dihedral to get onto another ledge. From there follow the crack in the dihedral. A crack on either side of the dihedral lead un onto a small ramp below some loose rocks. Trend right to finish in the obvious widening crack. Bolted anchors to the right of the crack.

climbs.name: Dwarf Starr
climbs.fa: GU Kevander Fox, Dylan Welcome, summer 2017

content.description: Traversing gravely jugs to gain access to anchors if you're looking for an easy access to the TR on Midnight Comet and Deadpool
content.location: Shares anchors with Midnight Comet and Deadpool

content.description: shallow hand crack and face climbing, very poor gear placements.
Climb the face up decent crimps, fins and side pulls.  6 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Right of the blank-face and 6' tall detached flake.  The anchor is located on the greenish-patch of granite, which is down and left of the obvious bush.
